column2: let's see. It's a three-line rail-fence
column5:
g...d-a-r-l...Got it: 'Darling Hepzibah'
Hepzibah? What kind of name is that?
'Will meet you Reading Sunday 15.25 train Didcot-Reading.' Reading you all right

column1: 1525|three twenty-five|The next afternoon Mr. Underhill finished at the office early and took the three o'clock train
column2: arriving out in Green Town at three twenty-five
column3: in plenty of time to drink in the brisk rays of the autumnal sun.
